Feature: Nordics and several other European countries
NMT: Worldwide, all countries except Japan and South Korea

Feature: Good coverage due to low frequencies
NMT: Good coverage indoors on 850/900 MHz. Repeaters possible. 35 km hard limit.
GSM: Unlimited cell size, low transmitter power permits large cells
IS-95 (CDMA one): Unlimited cell size, low transmitter power permits large cells
IS-2000 (CDMA 2000): Smaller cells and lower indoors coverage on 2100 MHz; equivalent coverage indoors and superior range to GSM on 850/900 MHz.
UMTS (3GSM): Smaller cells and lower coverage on the S band.

NMT: 0.2 MHz = 8 timeslots. Each timeslot can hold up to 2 calls (4 calls with VAMOS) through interleaving.
IS-2000 (CDMA 2000): 5 MHz = 2 Mbit/s. 42Mbit/s for HSPA+. Each call uses 1.8-12 kbit/s depending on chosen quality and audio complexity.

UMTS (3GSM): No (data only)Voice possible through VoLTE or fallback to 2G/3G
5G NR: Voice and Data at the same time
